alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Bamberg; Barnwell; Calhoun; Lexington; Orangeburg; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 04 at 10:35AM EST until January 04 at 11:15AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Calhoun County in central South Carolina... Eastern Barnwell County in central South Carolina... Bamberg County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Lexington County in central South Carolina... West central Sumter County in central South Carolina... Northeastern Aiken County in central South Carolina... Orangeburg County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Richland County in central South Carolina... * Until 1115 AM EST. * At 1034 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Red Bank to near Blackville to near Martin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of producing wind damage. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Orangeburg, Barnwell, Bamberg, Denmark, McEntire Air Base, Brookdale, Blackville, St. Matthews, Gaston, Branchville, Bowman, Eastover, Orangeburg County Airport, Barnwell State Park, Congaree National Park, Hopkins, Claflin College, South Carolina State University, Sandy Run and Gadsden. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 118 and 162. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EST for central South Carolina. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EST for central South Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Aiken; Bamberg; Barnwell; Calhoun; Lexington; Orangeburg; Richland; Sumter
